Manx: SAUM 113.
English: PSALM 113.

Manx: Gys tûnn y saum cheddin ayns baarle.
English: To the tune of the same psalm in English.

Manx: Shiuish nooghyn as shirveishee’n Chiarn,
English: Ye saints and servants of the Lord

Manx: Jeh mooayds e ghloayr gowjee arrane ;
English: Sing of the extent of his glory

Manx: Da ennym noo cur ooashley bra.
English: Give eternal praise to his name.

Manx: Veih’n ayrn jeh’n seihll ta’n ghrian girree
English: From the part of the world where the sun rises

Manx: Dys yn eer boayll t’eh goll dy lhie,
English: To as far as the very place it sets,

Manx: Jeh e ennym yrd jeanjee imraa.
English: Speak of his high name.

Manx: Trooid-magh yn seihll she Jee ta rere;
English: Throughout the world it is God who rules;

Manx: Cha vel yn cheer dy vaynrys seyr
English: The land of free happiness

Manx: Ogh scaa fardalagh jeh e ghloayr.
English: Is but a vain shadow of his glory

Manx: Rish’yn, e reilltys ta erskyn,
English: Compared to him, whose kingdom is above,

Manx: Eh chroo yn niau t’eh cummal ayn,
English: Let him, who created the heaven he dwells in,

Manx: Ny-lhig ve soyllit prince na pooar.
English: Not be compared to prince or power.

Manx: Ga ayns e stayd
English: t’erskyn cur geill
column3: Although in his state he is above giving heed

Manx: Ayns niau ta heose, da ainleyn reill,
English: In heaven that is up there, to angels dwelling,

Manx: Fooast gys yn ooir sgooidsave lesh croym:
English: Still to the earth he is willing to stoop:

Manx: Yn ymmyrchagh t’eh troggal seose
English: ,He raises up the needy
column3: Veih’n thorran injil dys y phlaase
column4: ,From the low midden to the palace
column5:
Ny heshey da'n er s’ooasle t’ayn,       A partner for the most noble person there is.
Traa
column9: When, for lack of children, the kin complain,

Manx: T’eh eirey coyrt, lesh bea as slaynt,
English: He brings an heir, with life and health,

Manx: Myr shen sauail yn ennym-chynn;
English: So saving the family name;

Manx: Cur er yn ghennish dy reayll thie,
English: Making the barren to keep house,

Manx: As ve ny moir gherjoil as mie.—
English: And be a comforting and good mother.—

Manx: O moyll jee eisht e ghloayr smoo beayn!
English: O praise ye then his most everlasting glory!
